channel.title: Server.conn (Adding SQL (World Objects) To a server) Will R E P ++
channel.description:
[code]WorldObject.java:37: cannot find symbol symbol : variable conn location: class server Statement statement = server.conn.createStatement(); ^ WorldObject.java:38: cannot find symbol symbol : variable conn location: class server Statement statement2 = server.conn.createStatement(); ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 2 errors Files Compiled Successfully! Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
I'm trying to add World Objects to my sql database, I need to know - Am I getting this error because I didnt declare a method or variable or w/e in my server.java or is it due to the fact that I didnt have my sql database up and running at the time.?

item.title: Server.conn (Adding SQL (World Objects) To a server) Will R E P ++
item.dc:creator: @Epic_One Epic One
item.description:
@Epic_One wrote:

Ah, Perfect. Exactly what I was looking for. Thanks, I’ll spend some time reading up on it.

Read full topic
item.source: Server.conn (Adding SQL (World Objects) To a server) Will R E P ++

item.title: Server.conn (Adding SQL (World Objects) To a server) Will R E P ++
item.dc:creator: @varek varek
item.description:
@varek wrote:

Nice tutorial for database accessing in java: http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/jdbc/

the expression server.conn is referring to a static variable ‘conn’ in the server class.
I’m guessing you want ‘conn’ to be a java.sql.Connection object. See the link above for how to get/use it.

Read full topic

conn should be a initialization of sql connection

like

public static SQLConnection conn;

or something.

item.source: Server.conn (Adding SQL (World Objects) To a server) Will R E P ++

item.title: Server.conn (Adding SQL (World Objects) To a server) Will R E P ++
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

Well your calling a variable called:

“conn”
that is in your server.java, and inside the variable there is:

createStatement();

Which makes no sense, so yes you haven’t declared the method “conn” in server.java

But no point in putting conn, when you are looking for the method createStatement();. So you might want to fix that.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Epic_One wrote:

In server.java the closest thing I have that’s related to the word “conn” is “Connections”

public static String[] Connections = new String[MaxConnections];

I doubt that’s even close to related to the problem at hand, But other than that - I dont have a “conn” in server.java, Is that something I’ll have to declare myself - If so, any chance you could explain it a bit more in detail?

Much love.

Read full topic
